intro: Halimolobos rigidus, commonly known as the rigid halimolobos, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. It is adapted to dry climates and can withstand periods of drought. Halimolobos rigidus is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
